sentences.english: This fable criticizes those ignorant and arrogant people.
sentences.chinese: 這則寓言諷刺了那些孤陋寡聞，又盲目自大的人。

sentences.english: Were our ancestors lucky to be only partly informed?
sentences.chinese: 我們的祖先孤陋寡聞是否算幸運呢？

sentences.english: Scientists actually know little about how animals perform their navigational feats.
sentences.chinese: 科學家們對動物的這種導航絕技卻是孤陋寡聞的。

sentences.english: Forgive my ignorance , but what exactly are you talking about?
sentences.chinese: 請原諒我的孤陋寡聞，你說的到底是什麼？

sentences.english: We are all too ignorant to hear of such a term before.
sentences.chinese: 是我們都太孤陋寡聞，竟然沒聽說過激情殺人。

sentences.english: If you live in the country, you soon get out of touch with things.
sentences.chinese: 如果你住在鄉下，你很快會變得孤陋寡聞。

definition: unable to help however much one would like to (idiom); Although we sympathize, there is no way to help you./My hands are tied.
to digress/to stray from the subject
to overdose on supplementary medicine/to cram too hard
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
to err/to dial a wrong number/to make a typo
to keep one's calm in the face of the unexpected/not to wonder at strange sights
to remain silent/to have nothing to say/(coll.) speechless/dumbfounded
